preqs: This course is only available to those students whose research project requires training for independent operation of the transmission electron microscope (TEM) within the Monash Centre for Electron Microscopy (MCEM). This requirement will be determined by MCEM staff during a new user interview, which also must be attended with their research supervisor(s) before enrolment. Students should refer to the access section of the MCEM website to arrange a new user interview.Students must also attend a MCEM new user induction and sign the MCEM Safety Induction Checklist and User Agreement.

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course type {02}

description: The transmission electron microscope (TEM) provides the unique ability to characterise materials at the nanometre and atomic length scales. This course is designed to offer both theoretical and practical training in operating a TEM, for those who need the technique for their research. The emphasis is to arm students with the skills necessary to both effectively operate the instrument and make meaningful conclusions regarding the results generated.
